work.name: DICE Lab, University of Gothenburg
work.summary: Currently working as research engineer in the I-AIMS project aimed at investigating how to enhance safety and well-being of drivers using a combination of biometric driver monitoring and vocalised feedback from a large language model. Previosly worked as part of STINT initiation grant funded project between the University of Gothenburg and Koç University researching humanoid social robotics, affective computing and digitalised gamified cognitive interventions. Have also been researching human/robot interaction and gamified therapeutics for cognitive interventions for Danish Brain+.
highlights: I-AIMS project: LLMs, autonomous vehicles and driver monitoring.

work.name: Human Factors Psychology Lab, Seoul National University
work.summary: Collaborated with an international and interdisciplinary cohort and assisted research in affective human/robot interaction, applied cognitive psychology, UI/UX, social robotics and VR.
highlights: Active member of academic skill workshop. Demonstrated usage of Furhat robot design social interface and acquired field-relevant academic presentation and discussion skills.

work.name: EthicAI
work.summary: Founding team member, senior consultant and lead product engineer at global ethical AI advisory firm that working with clients to build trust in AI solutions by empowering organizations to develop and deploy innovative and ethical artificial intelligence. Our approach focuses on managing risk and reducing social and environmental harms associated with AI technologies.

volunteer.summary: The 16th International Conference on Social Robotics bring together researchers and practitioners working on the interaction between humans and intelligent robots and on the integration of social robots into our society.

volunteer.organization: Cambridge University Centre for Human Inspired AI
volunteer.summary: CHIA brings together an interdisciplinary community of researchers to investigate the innovative ways in which human and machine intelligence can be combined to yield AI which is capable of contributing to social and global progress.

We aim to create a new repository of better images of AI that anyone can use and to mitigate current dominant images of AI that reinforce dangerous misconceptions, and limit the public understanding of the current use and workings of AI systems, their potential and implications.

Sweden's largest youth organisation for environment and climate change, where I, among other things, organised a trip to Paris for young people to attend COP21 and have a platform making their voice heard in the discourse around climate.

education.institution: University of Cambridge, Lucy Cavendish College

courses: AI in Urban Planning, Architecture and Design

awards.title: Nova 111 Student List 2023
awards.summary: Selected as one of the 111 young people with most potential in Sweden (Mathematics, Data, and Analytics).

awards.title: Career Stipend - Student
awards.summary: Motivation: 'Alva Markelius studerar kognitionsvetenskap med inriktning mot artificiell intelligens och robotik vid Göteborgs universitet, när hon tar emot stipendiet läser hon sista termin vid Seol National University. Hon jobbar också extra i ett labb där man forskar inom robotik, VR och interaktionen mellan människa och robot. För Alva är det viktigt att använda AI-tekniken rätt och i framtiden vill hon jobba för en arbetsgivare som har en förankring i både forskning och industri, gärna i en internationell miljö. Hon vill också jobba vidare med etiska aspekter och riktlinjer för teknik. Alva sökte Karriärstipendiet för att kunna studera en masterutbilning utomlands, och vi är övertygade om att hon kommer lyckas med sina studier och framtida karriär.'

awards.title: 100 Brilliant Women in AI Ethics™
awards.summary: The list is published annually to recognize rising stars as well as pioneers in the AI Ethics space as part of a continuing effort to make AI more diverse and accessible for everyone.
